Trial_Design.evidence: This phase III trial randomized patients

Participants.evidence: Patients with Dukes’ B3 and C disease

Intervention.evidence: randomized patients to receive continuous infusional 5-FU for 7 days starting within 24 h after curative resection (arm A) or no perioperative 5-FU (arm B)

Objective.evidence: The primary endpoint of the trial was overall survival in patients with Dukes’ B3 and C disease.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint of the trial was overall survival in patients with Dukes’ B3 and C disease.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From August 1993 to May 2000, 859 patients were enrolled and 855 randomized (arm A: 427; arm B: 428).

Result_Outcome.evidence: no statistically significant difference in OS [median 10.3 years (95% CI 8.4, 13.2) for perioperative chemotherapy and 9.3 years (95% CI 5.7, 12.3) for no perioperative therapy, one-sided log-rank p = 0.178, HR = 0.88 (95% CI 0.66, 1.16)]

Harms.evidence: 18% of arm A patients experienced grade 3 or greater toxicity.
